Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.abstract: Advisory committee to the Smith College Board of Trustees. Contains meeting minutes, memoranda, newspaper clippings and lists.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Board of Counselors was founded in 1950 by the Smith College Board of Trustees as an advisory committee. It was a revolving board made up of 25 members, originally either alumnae, their husbands, or fathers, who possessed some expertise and provided advice and opinions in specialized areas such as health, art, public relations, music, theatre, etc. Each counselor served on the board for five years, unless re-appointed. The Board of Counselors was divided into smaller committees which included: Afro-American Studies; Botanic Gardens; Campus School; Careers; Chapel; College Relations; Friends of the Library; Health Services; Multicultural Affairs; Museum; Nominating; Residence; School for Social Work; Science of Engineering; and Theatre. Each committee met once or twice a year. The Board of Trustees elected each committee chair and the general chair, who met annually in October at the time of the Trustees' meeting. The general chair of the Board of Counselors would then join the Board of Trustees meeting to report on the Board of Counselors' annual activity and advice.

Originally the Board of Counselors worked with the President of the College and the Board of Trustees in order to advise them in their duties of directing the college, as well as being available to the faculty for counsel and also worked with alumnae, friends of the college, and the general public to insure a wider understanding of college policies, plans, and needs. However, in 1998, the Board of Counselors stopped reporting to the Board of Trustees, and the position of general chair was discontinued. Instead, the committee chairs work more closely with department heads and senior staff members to serve the specific needs of each department. Committee chairs work with department heads to plan meetings as needed. The President makes all appointments to the Board of Counselors committees, including all committee chairs. Official committee correspondence, reports, and nominations for committee membership are channeled through the Office of the President. See the file titled History in Series I: General for an overview of the changes made to the counselors over the years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records of the Board of Counselors are composed primarily of meeting minutes, memoranda, newspaper clippings and lists. The documents were created between 1933-1998 with the majority falling within 1950-1988. There are a few photographs in Series I. General as well as in the files of individual counselors in Series III. Individuals. The records provide a good overview of the history of the counselors and the type of work they performed. The procedure manual dating from 1957-1971 is particularly useful for information about how the group organized itself and the purpose of the various committees.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Board of Counselors records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00008, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Additions to these records arrive in the College Archives on a regular basis. Please contact the College Archives for the most up-to-date information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The first three series: General, Subject Files and Individuals are open without restrictions. The series on Annual Meetings and Committees are permanently closed and open only to the Board of Trustees, the staff in the Office of the President, and the professional staff in the College Archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records of the Board of Counselors came to the College Archives through various channels. Information about individual counselors and the activities of the group were collected by the staff in the archives over the years. In addition to that material, Rosemary Wilcox Dickerson '51, Chair of the Counselors from 1991-98, donated most of the annual meeting and committee materials (Accessions 98A-72, 00A-65). Material was also transferred from the Office of the President (Accession 00A-64).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Karen Eberhart and Valerie Love '02.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes historical information about the founding and operation of the Counselors. It also contains lists of the Counselors for nearly every year of their existence. Counselor lists can also be found in the Course Catalog. This series is open without restrictions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains folders on subjects of concern to the college. Most of the topics center around the issue of diversity on campus. This series is open without restrictions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series has a file for most of the individuals who served as counselors. The files consist of press releases announcing their election as a counselor and in some cases also a brief biographical sketch, curriculum vitae and/or a photograph. Lists of Counselors and their terms of service can be found in Series I, the College Archives card catalog under Counselors and in the Course Catalogs. These files are open without restrictions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the agendas, minutes and supporting documentation for the counselors annual meetings. The files are permanently closed and open only to the Board of Trustees, President's Office staff and the professional staff in the College Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes the files documenting the work of the committees. The files include agendas, minutes and supporting documentation. The files are permanently closed and open only to the Board of Trustees, President's Office staff and the professional staff in the College Archives.
